channel.title: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times
channel.description:
http://www.latimes.com/business/technology/la-fi-tn-facebook-opera-browser-20120525,0,5360169.story
If this plan falls through, Opera will likely lose 90% of their users...

item.title: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I can already see the fanboys all of the sudden loving Opera because of it’s ‘great functionality, and smooth design’.

Read full topic
item.source: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times

item.title: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“mopman_sucks, post:2, topic:443218”]because 90% of opera users hate facebook?

where did you get that stupid fucking number?[/quote]I’ve always been under the impression that the average computer user has no idea what Opera is. By my logic, since the average user doesn’t know what Opera is, I’m assuming that 90% of Opera users are non-Facebook users.

I made an error in my logic.

Read full topic
item.source: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times

item.title: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

If they were to do this, even if there was some sense to your comment of “Opera will likely lose 90% of their users…” they’d still gain a baijillion more users than what they already have, just for the exposure Facebook can provide to people who usually wouldn’t care.

Read full topic
item.source: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times

item.title: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Opera Software ASA and Mozilla Corporation have about the same revenue, so Opera is doing fine with a “crappy browser”. Only reason I use Firefox is to visit Moparisthebest.com, as Opera doesn’t like it for some strange reason.

Before flaming, I had the same problems with FF and Chrome a while ago.

Read full topic
item.source: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times

item.title: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Opera has always been a pretty crappy browser anyhow, at least on the desktop. Opera Mini is pretty good on a cell phone though, with the exception of no help for web hosts (scroll to bottom):
http://dev.opera.com/articles/view/opera-mini-request-headers/

Read full topic
item.source: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times

90% of its users is, what… 25 people anyways?

item.title: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

latimes

Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser?

The Facebook spending spree may be continuing as a new report says the social networking giant might be looking to buy Norwegian company Opera Software.Now fully under the microscope of Wall Street...

If this plan falls through, Opera will likely lose 90% of their users…

Read full topic
item.source: Is Facebook going to buy Opera, make its own browser? - LA Times
